result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Minniear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family), with exception to the Family Wizard with regards to the children. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. $200 DNA surcharge assessed. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Minniear

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew W Kline in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J Minniear in court. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue 

Defendant requests adjournment just received an offer; requests pleas date. 
State does not object; and puts offer on record. 
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim E.M(person, property, residence or family). Child custody exchanges need to be done via 3rd party.

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael J Minniear appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Michael J Minniear. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
